import React from 'react'; import '../Duties.css'; import Navbar from './Navbar'; import Footer from './Footer'; export default function Duty8() { return ( <>

Fundamental Duty 8: Develop Scientific Temper

Article 51A(h) - Cultivating rational thinking and humanism

üß© Comprehensive Understanding

Article 51A(h) establishes a civic obligation to develop:

  • Scientific Temper: Evidence-based reasoning and skepticism towards dogma
  • Humanism: Ethical philosophy emphasizing human welfare
  • Spirit of Inquiry: Curiosity and questioning attitude
  • Reformist Outlook: Willingness to challenge outdated social practices

This duty connects with constitutional values of liberty of thought and expression (Article 19).

üìñ Detailed Explanation

The implementation framework includes:

  • Educational Initiatives:
    • National Curriculum Framework's emphasis on critical thinking
    • Science popularization programs by NCERT and state boards
    • National Science Day (February 28) celebrations
  • Policy Mechanisms:
    • Science and Technology Policy 2003
    • Rashtriya Avishkar Abhiyan for school students
    • Institutions like CSIR, DST, and INSA
  • Legal Framework:
    • Anti-superstition laws in some states
    • Regulation of pseudoscientific claims in media
    • Consumer protection against fraudulent practices

üìú Historical Context

This duty emerged from:

  • Nehruvian Vision:
    • Jawaharlal Nehru's "Scientific Temper" concept
    • Emphasis on science as foundation of modern India
  • Social Reform Movements:
    • Raja Ram Mohan Roy's rationalist approach
    • Jyotiba Phule's critique of caste system
    • Periyar's self-respect movement
  • Constitutional Debates:
    • 42nd Amendment (1976) during push for modernization
    • Response to growing obscurantism and superstitions

üèõÔ∏è Judicial Interpretations

  • Aruna Roy v. Union of India (2002) : Upheld inclusion of value education including scientific temper in curriculum. [(2002) 7 SCC 368]
  • Nandini Sundar v. State of Chhattisgarh (2011) : Cited scientific temper in context of rational governance. [(2011) 7 SCC 547]
  • Indian Medical Association v. Union of India (2011) : Emphasized scientific basis for medical practices. [(2011) 7 SCC 179]

üîç Contemporary Challenges

  • Combating pseudoscience and misinformation
  • Balancing tradition with scientific outlook
  • Promoting critical thinking in digital age
  • Addressing science skepticism in policymaking
  • Encouraging girls in STEM education
); }
